tweets.text:
We continue to deal with a large fuel spillage on the #A19 following an earlier 3 vehicle RTC. 

We are working together to open the road as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience & co-operation @clevelandfire @EnvAgency @highwaysagency

Read more: https://t.co/mCVnG3PvW8 https://t.co/qdsPk5ayOi

HISTORIC MOMENT - shad are through the Diglis fish pass👏
Blocked for 180yrs, these speedy shad are wasting no time now & heading upriver to spawn #FollowTheShad #SevernShadRun #FishMigration @CanalRiverTrust @SevenRivers @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @HullUniScience @ChrisGPackham https://t.co/zHQ1Onfjg5

Was anyone else gobsmacked by the NFU's refusal to acknowledge the role of intensive animal farming on river pollution last night? @BBCCountryfile @Feargal_Sharkey @GeorgeMonbiot @SalmonTroutCons @RiverActionUK @WindrushWasp @SimonLennane @wrurestore @theriverstrust @river_usk https://t.co/93te00nzSz

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text:
Bathing water season has started! 🌊🌊

To help you plan, you can check how clean the water is at your local beach or further afield before heading out. 

Check the water quality of your local beach: https://t.co/G2HSZKBvK8 https://t.co/7LB0LQYIzk

tweets.text: @defra we really need you to sort out Walleys Quarry , @EnvAgency have not done so , the tail is wagging the dog over this issue . We've been fobbed off enough now , please get this festering ,rancid , gas producing hell hole closed down . @StinkStopthe

@DENISEL37953929 @SimonLennane @GValleyAG2 @EnvAgency @timthefruit @EMorfett @HelenStace_HWT There are good and bad people in every walk of life, just as there are good and bad farming practices. Absolutely EVERYONE whose activities affect water quality has a part to play.

@EnvAgencyMids is this your new tactic to reduce complaints about the poison being inflicted on us in Newcastle under lyme ? I suppose it's cheaper than actually doing something tangible ! @StinkStopthe https://t.co/xKyqNreUNj
Our Windrush neighbour the River Coln is dying and the @EnvAgency just lets it happen. Sound familiar? @Feargal_Sharkey @tomheapmedia https://t.co/j5b4e08b6g

Fantastic news for South Yorkshire's Dearne Valley.
The area has seen an amazing transformation in recent decades. 
As well as providing habitat for bird species, areas of the wetlands also help reduce flood risk to communities downstream, including Doncaster. https://t.co/0T9A4cUL6K

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgencyMids hope you’ve enjoyed a lovely weekend . All that lovely fresh air , well just to keep you updated we’ve had our regular doses of HYDROGEN SULFIDE  here in Newcastle under Lyme . All thanks to you and your good friends at red Industries .@StinkStopthe

Has your farm been affected by flooding? The @EnvAgency has outlined how it’ll achieve the aims set out in the National Flood and Coastal Erosion Risk Management Strategy to help protect England from flooding and coastal erosion 👉 https://t.co/8nrgP4eela https://t.co/Q7G37HGO9w

York Flood Alleviation Scheme update:
Work continues on improving defences in the Rowntree Park area. 
Vehicle access to Roomzzz and caravan site will be via Butcher Terrace from Wednesday. 
Terry Avenue is closed from Skeldergate Bridge to Clementhorpe.
https://t.co/UHaRsscp0T https://t.co/YKdj5yeE2Y

More agricultural muck stored against the rules, literally on top of a watercourse this time. Directly under the muck pile runs a drainage ditch that runs straight into the River Frome, which runs straight into the Lugg, which exceeds phosphate limits. @EnvAgency /1 https://t.co/IhAXZqe2gs
Our staff are on-site by Millennium Bridge to answer questions today about the work, explain the road closure and diversions in place.
Down to you, @pow_rebecca @BorisJohnson and your cuts to @EnvAgency funding, allowing farmers to trash rivers across the country with chemical fertlizers. https://t.co/NYO5BSTnno

tweets.text: This is just shocking.  How can a farmer let their soil run off like this?  And how can @EnvAgency turn a blind eye to the increased phosphate pollution this will cause? https://t.co/AY9H9wEdQ7

Update from the ongoing incident @shropsfire at Greenway Polymers. #ThankYou for your continued support. @TelfordWrekin @EnvAgency @StaffsFire for Waste fire TacAd support, @HWFire for the drone @HighwaysWMIDS & not forgetting our own amazing staff from right across the service https://t.co/8fWixKgxuf

Save the date! Weds 16th June, 9:30am - 10:30am BST/(UTC+1) we’re hosting a webinar on #data & the #environment with these brilliant speakers: @abi_edin from @GeospatialC, Chris Jarvis from @EnvAgency, our CEO @billroberts & Darren Barnes of @ons. More details soon ... https://t.co/vGjdiqkSHF

This is the River Arrow today. It runs to theLugg then the Wye. Lugg is an SSSI & Wye a SAC. Failing their phosphate targets for over a decade. 2 year moratorium stopping all new homes, schools, medical facilities, tourism accommodation even though EA say pollution is 65% Agri. https://t.co/0RGQFGIcvb

Look what #teamskillmill found in #Newcastle. A secret garden in one of our parks. Hidden treasures indeed @altweet_pet @NU_Foundation @urbangreenncl @NewcastleCC @EnvAgencyYNE @NorthEastTweets @ChronicleLive https://t.co/GUDOzDgTQf

*CECAN Webinar* 'Systems Approaches to Water Management and Infrastructure Planning for Zero-Pollution Targets', Thu 17 Jun, 1 - 2pm. Presented by @AnaNMijic. Find out more & register free at: https://t.co/cIMy6FTA5S
@CSEI_imperial

@Team4Nature @ChrisGPackham @MarkAvery @MeganMcCubbin @IoloWilliams2 @WCL_News @RSBenwell @DaveGoulson @isabella_tree @domdyer70 @LGSpace Make sure to include the main agencies in any tweets. Don't just shout at the wind. - Raptor persecution Cats Pesticides Foxhunting  Leadshot Mass gamebird releases  Badger Culls  #stateofnature We're making progress but we must act for the Nature we love @DefraNature @EnvAgency

Reminding you your promises to Punjab @capt_amarinder. You promised to improve tree cover in 2017 but now you are getting 136 Acres deforested in Faridkot. Are you bent on breaking all your promises to Punjab? Shameful. https://t.co/ymalvAPbze

A lovely little chalk stream completely unaffected by local developments 🙄@EYRiversTrust @WildTroutTrust @NaturalEngland @YWDirectors @YWT_North @Yorkshire_Wolds @WoldsWeekly https://t.co/NjH12gAldP

@watsonchas @BBCCountryfile @nrw @FriendsUpperWye The Environment Agency told us there was no evidence of pollution in the river Windrush - with a straight face. It seems to be what the regulators do, when caught out.

tweets.text:
#FloodandCoast2021 are delighted to have @JacobsConnects as a sponsor. Jacobs is the lead consultant working with the @EnvAgency on the Broadland Flood Alleviation Project, a unique 20-year scheme to improve and maintain 240 km of wetland flood defences.
https://t.co/hMfPxO9zw1 https://t.co/Wk0wL4pQwG

We use money from fishing rod licence fees to improve fish stocks and habitats across England.

So remember, a fishing licence isn't just a licence, it's something to be proud of!

Buy your new licence at: https://t.co/fx56eQ45pG https://t.co/tGvt3QeUAO

tweets.text:
For Water Saving Week, we will be tweeting about how we manage water resources across the North West

North West latest Water Situation Report: https://t.co/xsRDrdvcGT https://t.co/fMti6iVj41

An assessment by @EnvAgency of the Wye, estimates the chief source of pollution (~60%+) is agricultural and waste water from existing homes (~25%). Sustainable house builder @MerryAlbright has estimated new homes on the Wye contribute less than 1% of phosphate loading.

tweets.text:
£58,000 was invested in fisheries in #Essex, #Norfolk and #Suffolk last year🐟

The money was spent on helping to set up a lake for military veterans suffering from PTSD, clearing vegetation at a lake and stablising fishing banks.

Read more: https://t.co/6XgT9KAyD4 @IcarpCic https://t.co/PU7EjIabSF

Current Magazine now available! This edition marks the @EnvAgency hitting the 300K homes better protected from the risk of flooding target. 
Read about ‘Success in Shoreham’ - https://t.co/NLGsnbBHIb & ‘Carbon modelling at Hythe Ranges’ - https://t.co/2kEyzIijhV
#FCERM #TeamEA https://t.co/R9sMfJN8Fo

@SevernUnlocked @CanalRiverTrust @SevenRivers @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @HullUniScience @ChrisGPackham This is so exciting! 180 years of delays; 8 years of work to get to this point! Well done everyone

My first @BBCCountryfile *EXCLUSIVE* has revealed the full extent of the #phosphates and #nitrates crisis in England... there are now 30,000+ homes effectively on ice 🧊. Last year, @BorisJohnson said he would use a 'dyno-rod' to unblock the housing logjam… but still no plunger.

tweets.text:
Via the NEW Diglis fish pass, twaite shad can now swim past #Worcester on their #SevernShadRun for the first time in nearly 180yrs! 🎉🐟🎉 
Please watch & share our video! #FollowTheShad #FishMigration @CanalRiverTrust @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @HeritageFundM_E @LIFEprogramme https://t.co/kzh7NFPljc

Yesterday's @BBCCountry file reminded us yet again that it's the citizen scientists @FriendsUpperWye  who now seem responsible for monitoring the health of our rivers. The re-funding of our water regulators @WaterNRW @EnvAgency so they can do their job properly is such a priority https://t.co/dtvvPPQb9P
